alert.note: Alert for Botetourt; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 8:50PM EDT until August 26 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Botetourt County in west central Virginia... Northeastern Roanoke County in west central Virginia... * Until 300 AM EDT Friday. * At 850 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in a stationary thunderstorm that was producing torrential rainfall rates. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roanoke... Troutville... Cloverdale... Daleville... Laymantown... Hollins... Nace... This includes the following streams and drainages... Stony Battle Creek, Coyner Branch, Jumping Run Creek, Laymantown Creek, Tinker Creek, Buffalo Creek, Cook Creek and Carvin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
